title: Everyday English Course 127
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Hey, Bob, what are you up to this weekend?
M: Nothing in particular. Why? Do you have something in mind?
W: Yeah. A friend of mine told me about a relatively new bar in the centre of town. It's called The Pharmacy and the decor is made of old medical stuff.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Hey, Bob, what are you up to this weekend?
M: Nothing in particular. Why? Do you have something in mind?
W: Yeah. A friend of mine told me about a relatively new bar in the centre of town. It's called The Pharmacy and the decor is made of old medical stuff.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Hey, Bob, what are you up to this weekend?
M: Nothing in particular. Why? Do you have something in mind?
W: Yeah. A friend of mine told me about a relatively new bar in the centre of town. It's called The Pharmacy and the decor is made of old medical stuff.
{a}

answerOptions: A new bar in the town.

variables.a: What are they talking about?

answerOptions: Put the car in the garage.

variables.a: What will the man probably do?
Who has been to Yellowstone National Park?
Which floor is the meeting room?

answerOptions: She went to the wrong place.
She couldn't take the cake back.

variables.a: Why did the woman apologize?

answerOptions: He is usually late for work.
There is always something wrong with his bike.

variables.a: What is true about Mr. Brown?
How much does one shirt cost?
How does the woman feel?
How many times has the man seen the movie?

answerOptions: She has canceled her trip to the north.
They also may get a lot of snow.
instances.correctAnswer: They also may get a lot of snow.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What will the weather probably be like tomorrow?
When should the woman hand in the project?

answerOptions: She will go to the headquarters.
She will fill in the forms.
instances.correctAnswer: She will go to the headquarters.

variables.a: Why can't the woman go to the man's office?

answerOptions: Her mother made up the story.
She didn't tell the man the truth.
instances.correctAnswer: She didn't tell the man the truth.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: She has to work on weekends.
She works for only eight hours each day.
instances.correctAnswer: She has to work on weekends.

variables.a: What does the woman really imply?

answerOptions: The woman has to get the textbooks in other ways.
The woman has sold her used textbooks to the bookstore.
The man is going to buy his textbooks from a bookstore.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman has to get the textbooks in other ways.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?
What's the speed limit in this area?

answerOptions: It failed for lack of fund.

variables.a: What happened to Mr. Runt's project?
Where is Wallace now?
What are they mainly talking about?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: He went to visit a friend.
He went to say goodbye to his friend at the airport.
He went to another city with his friend.
instances.correctAnswer: He went to say goodbye to his friend at the airport.

variables.a: What did the man do last night?

answerOptions: They should go up to Bob's study.
Bob should decide about English for himeself.
instances.correctAnswer: Bob should decide about English for himeself.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
What does the woman suggest the man do?
What is the woman doing?
How many people does the school football team also need?
Who will go to America?

answerOptions: He doesn't work in the hospital.

variables.a: How is Jim now?

answerOptions: Review the details of all her lessons.
Focus on the main points of her lectures.
Talk with her about his learning problems.
instances.correctAnswer: Focus on the main points of her lectures.

variables.a: How does the women suggest the man prepare for Professor Yang's exam?
How late at least does the man have to check his ticket?
What time is it now?
